intro: Pityothamnus pygmaeus, commonly known as the dwarf thamnoid, is a small, flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous blooms that are often overlooked. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
